item.title: Clarion Banks $676 Million to Make Digital Transformation Bets
item.description: The firm sees opportunities in sectors such as media where digital technology has upended traditional models.

item.title: French Asset Manager AXA IM to Buy Private-Equity Secondary Specialist W Capital
item.description: The $900 billion investment manager is betting that more private-equity managers will use secondary transactions to generate returns from their funds.

item.title: Showtime at Disney; Dow Futures Drift Lower
item.description: Stock futures ticked lower ahead of jobs and services data.

item.title: Google Is More Resilient Than Its AI Stumbles Imply
item.description: Google’s stock has lagged behind other tech giants even as its search business proves resilient to AI incursions.

item.title: Chase Bank to Let Advertisers Target Customers Based on Spending Data
item.description: The JPMorgan Chase bank’s new unit called Chase Media Solutions will let marketers tempt Chase customers with targeted deals and discounts related to their spending history.

item.title: Ugandan Court Upholds Large Parts of Antigay Law
item.description: The legislation imposes lengthy sentences and has resulted in sanctions from the U.S. and others.

item.title: Eurozone Inflation Cools, Setting Stage for June Rate Cut
item.description: The eurozone’s annual rate of inflation fell for the third straight month in March, a surprise that makes it more likely that the European Central Bank will cut its key interest rate in June.

item.title: India's Unusual Jobs Math: More Education Equals a Higher Chance of Unemployment
item.description: India is one of the fastest-growing major economies in the world, but it is struggling to find enough well-paid jobs for millions of its highly educated graduates.

item.title: This Final Four Team Isn't a Long Shot. It's a 23,512-to-1 Miracle.
item.description: Three weeks ago, N.C. State had next to no chance of making the NCAA tournament. Now they’re two wins away from a national title. The odds of that happening aren’t just small, they’re lower than the likelihood that you’ll be struck by lightning.

item.title: Commuters Wage Last-Ditch Effort Against $15 Manhattan Congestion Charge
item.description: Congestion pricing is planned to take effect in June, but the pending litigation could delay it.

item.title: Business Schools Are Going All In on AI
item.description: American University and other top M.B.A. programs are reorienting courses around artificial intelligence. “It has eaten our world.”

item.title: The Jobs Numbers Aren't Adding Up. Immigration Helps Explain Why.
item.description: Differing population estimates could explain a growing discrepancy in the numbers.

item.title: Genmab to Boost Oncology Portfolio With ProfoundBio Buy
item.description: Danish biotech Genmab will buy U.S.-based ProfoundBio for $1.8 billion in cash as it looks to bolster its pipeline of cancer treatments.

item.title: Taiwan's Strongest Earthquake in 25 Years Kills at Least Seven
item.description: The magnitude-7.4 quake caused some buildings to partially collapse and injured more than 700 people.

item.title: Gold Sets Record High But Other Metal Prices Are Mixed
item.description: Gold futures hit a new record, with bullion’s bullish momentum from last week persisting into the second quarter on simmering geopolitical tensions in the Middle East, according to Pepperstone.

item.title: Oil Holds at Five-Month Highs on Supply Concerns
item.description: Oil prices held steady at five-month highs ahead of an OPEC+ meeting later on Wednesday, as global supplies are threatened by escalating hostilities in the Middle East and fresh waves of attacks against energy facilities in Ukraine and Russia.

item.title: Turkey Faces More Currency Pressure as Inflation Ticks Higher Again
item.description: There is little hope for recovery in the Turkish lira anytime soon, firm Conotoxia said, as price inflation continues to tick higher.

item.title: Turkish Inflation Keeps Rising as Erdogan Suffers Electoral Setback
item.description: Turkey’s consumer-price index , increased by 68.5% in March, accelerating from a 67.1% annual rate in February, while core prices that strip out the more volatile effects of energy, food, tobacco and gold, accelerated even faster.

item.title: Israel Blames Misidentification for Strike That Killed Gaza Aid Workers
item.description: The deaths of seven workers are piling pressure on Israel to protect people caught up in its war against Hamas.

item.title: U.S., German 10-Year Bond Yields Expected to Drift Lower On Six-Month Horizon
item.description: Aramea Asset Management forecasts the 10-year Treasury yield at 4% and the 10-year Bund yield at 2.25% in six months’ time, as central banks are likely to start interest-rate cuts.
